de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.math.spacefillingcurves

Class PeanoSpatialSorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.math.spacefillingcurves.AbstractSpatialSorter
      • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.math.spacefillingcurves.PeanoSpatialSorter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SpatialSorter

    public class PeanoSpatialSorter
extends AbstractSpatialSorter
    Bulk-load an R-tree index by presorting the objects with their position on the Peano curve. The basic shape of this space-filling curve looks like this: 
       3---4   9
   |   |   |
   2   5   8
   |   |   |
   1   6---7
    Which then expands to the next level as: 
       +-+ +-+ +-+ +-+ +
   | | | | | | | | |
   | +-+ +-+ | | +-+
   |         | |    
   | +-+ +-+ | | +-+
   | | | | | | | | |
   +-+ | | +-+ +-+ |
       | |         |
   +-+ | | +-+ +-+ |
   | | | | | | | | |
   + +-+ +-+ +-+ +-+
    and so on. INCOMPLETE attempt at a divide & conquer solution. TODO: for small sets, resort to different strategy? Dupe handling? Fixme: Orientations

      • sort

        public <T extends SpatialComparable> void sort(List<T> objs,
                                      int start,
                                      int end,
                                      double[] minmax)
        Description copied from interface: SpatialSorter
        Sort part of the list (start to end).
        Type Parameters:
        T - actual type we sort
        Parameters:
        objs - the spatial objects to be sorted
        start - First index to sort (e.g. 0)
        end - End of range (e.g. site())
        minmax - Array with dim pairs of (min, max) of value ranges

      • peanoSort

        protected <T extends SpatialComparable> void peanoSort(List<T> objs,

                                           double[] mms,

                                           BitSet bits,
                                           boolean desc)
        Sort by Peano curve.
        Parameters:
        objs - Objects
        start - Start index
        end - End
        mms - Minmax values
        dim - Dimension
        bits - Bit set for inversions
        desc - Current ordering
